sinks.reason: Missing input validation on operation type

sinks.name: TEE_AllocateOperation
sinks.reason: Missing input validation on operation context size

sinks.name: TEE_AllocateTransientObject
sinks.reason: Missing input validation on object type

sinks.name: TEE_AllocateTransientObject
sinks.reason: Missing input validation on maximum key size

sinks.name: TEE_InitRefAttribute
sinks.reason: Potential exposure of sensitive data if the buffer is shared with the Normal World

sinks.name: TEE_InitRefAttribute
sinks.reason: Lack of validation on buffer pointer and length could lead to buffer overflows or memory corruption

sinks.name: TEE_MACComputeFinal
sinks.reason: Potential leakage of MAC to Normal World if output buffer is shared

sinks.name: TEE_MACComputeFinal
sinks.reason: Manipulation of macLen could lead to buffer overflow or out-of-bounds access

sinks.name: TEE_MACInit
sinks.reason: Potential for exploitation if IV is tainted, leading to incorrect MAC initialization.

sinks.name: TEE_MACInit
sinks.reason: Potential for exploitation if IVLen is manipulated, leading to buffer overflows or incorrect MAC initialization.

sinks.name: TEE_MACUpdate
sinks.reason: Missing input validation - potential for buffer overflow or memory corruption due to manipulated chunkSize

sinks.name: TEE_MACUpdate
sinks.reason: Shared memory operations - potential for security issues if chunk points to shared memory with tainted data

sinks.name: TEE_PopulateTransientObject
sinks.reason: Tainted pointer to attributes could lead to buffer overflows or out-of-bounds access.

sinks.name: TEE_SetOperationKey
sinks.reason: Missing input validation on operation handle

sinks.name: TEE_SetOperationKey
sinks.reason: Missing input validation on key handle

sinks.name: memcpy
sinks.reason: Potentially writes tainted data to shared memory accessible by Normal World

sinks.name: memcpy
sinks.reason: Size parameter could be tainted, leading to buffer overflow

sinks.name: memcpy
sinks.reason: Source could be shared with Normal World, leading to data exposure

sinks.name: memset
sinks.reason: Size parameter could be tainted, leading to buffer overflows or out-of-bounds access.

sinks.name: memset
sinks.reason: If the pointer points to shared memory, tainted data could be written to Normal World.
